summary: This bill, the 'NCUA Central Liquidity Facility Enhancements Act,' aims to amend the Federal Credit Union Act. It focuses on the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA) Central Liquidity Facility, specifically addressing how credit unions can become Agent members. The bill is sponsored by Mr. Padilla and Mr. Cramer and was introduced in the Senate on July 30, 2025. The core of the bill involves revising the existing legislation to outline the conditions and mechanisms for credit unions' participation in the NCUA facility as agents.
